passages.text: See the end pages of this presentation for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures. J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
PTC is a global SaaS vendor that enables industrial and manufacturing companies to digitally transform how they engineer, manufacture, and service physical products throughout their lifecycle.
Key Segments are across Computer- Aided Design (CAD), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Application Lifecycle Management (ALM), and Service Lifecycle Management (SLM).
PTC primarily sells on- prem software (currently only \(\sim 25\%\) of PTC's ARR is SaaS) through a subscription license model.
PTC management team predominantly focuses on ARR and Free Cash Flow because ASC606 revenue recognition rules make PTC's P&L noisy.
Key FactsIPO: Dec 1989$2.3B in revenue in FY24&gt;7,500 employeesHeadquartered in Boston, MA$26B Market Cap~$210M in daily trading volume
Source: Company reports and Bloomberg Finance L.P.
- PTC discloses revenue split between its CAD and PLM segments, with CAD comprising \(\sim 38\%\) of revenue, and PLM the remaining \(62\%\) .
- As the company expects PLM segments to grow faster (ALM and SLM are included in PLM), PLM could become a larger part of the overall business.

This lifecycle begins with design engineering, and PTC provides CAD solutions for design of physical products (such as planes, trains, automobiles, blood dialysis machines, elevators, and other industrial products).
PTC's CAD products include both Creo and Onshape.

Creo is 3D Computer Aided Design (CAD) technology that allows companies to digitally design, test, and modify product models. Creo is PTC's flagship CAD product (Creo is the on- prem version and Creo+ is the SaaS version).

Onshape is a SaaS product development platform that connects CAD with collaboration tools and analytics; allows teams to give design reviews, comments, and edits in real time and compare design versions side by side.
Onshape was acquired more than five years ago and is PTC's cloud- native product to serve the eventual further industry appetite for cloud.

- PTC, Autodesk, Dassault (covered by JPM analyst Toby Ogg), and Siemens (covered by JPM analyst Akash Gupta) all have a presence in the CAD and PLM (product lifecycle management) space, with Dassault and Siemens traditionally viewed as leaders.- In manufacturing, Dassault and Siemens are leaders with their software offerings.- Hexagon is more so a leader among industrial and energy facilities and food and beverage (40-50% share).- In the industrial space, Hexagon (covered by JPM Analyst Joseph George) runs up against AVEVA from Schneider Electric (covered by JPM Analyst Akash Gupta) and Bentley, specifically on asset management, like Bentley's offering with IBM Maximo.
PTC also offers product lifecycle management (PLM) solutions across a wide breadth of customer verticals.
PTC's flagship PLM solution is its Windchill offering (Windchill is the on- prem version, whereas Windchill+ is the SaaS offering). Arena, acquired in PTC's FY21, is PTC's cloud- native PLM product.
Windchill and Arena manage all aspects of the product lifecycle from concept and development to servicing and end of life; Arena is frequently chosen by customers that outsource manufacturing

Windchill and Arena are systems of record for product data, enabling product data collaboration internally as well as externally. The PLM system itself provides out- of- the- box functionality and allows for customizability for specific use cases.
Windchill is a more mature product compared to Arena.
PTC frames Windchill and Arena as helping customers "get their product data house in order"
Main KPIs Customers Aim to Improve through PLM
Source: Company reports.

- PTC's Windchill PLM application suite manages product ideation through end of life, connecting stakeholders and bringing real time data to users.- PTC management sees the potential for PLM to grow as an area of customer interest.- PTC also has an industrial IoT solution called ThingWorx, which can power predictive maintenance solutions.- Siemens' PLM has a series of manufacturing software solutions, some of which utilize IoT (internet of things) to provide actionable insights for "Smart manufacturing."- One of Siemens solutions – Tecnomati - digitizes manufacturing and assembly processes to form a digital twin, increasing flexibility in terms of simulating advanced manufacturing techniques, and driving faster innovation.- Siemens's Teamcenter is a comprehensive PLM platform that unites design with managing production.

- ALM and SLM fall under PLM in PTC reporting.- Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is used for managing requirements in software development- Service Lifecycle Management (SLM) is applied for reducing downtime and ensuring better servicing of high-value, long-lifecycle products once they leave the manufacturing floor.- Codebeamer and Pure Variants are ALM solutions that help companies accelerate the development of products that contain software.- These tools are relevant for industries like auto and med-tech where software faces strict regulatory scrutiny.- Requirements management software acts as a single source of truth, so all developers have access to the same information. This application also enhances risk management and streamlines workflows for development teams.- ServiceMax is PTC's main SLM solution that helps companies improve the amount of time a piece of equipment is functioning and available for use.- ServiceMax ensures technicians have access to the proper data when out in the field- SLM business also includes software for spare parts optimization, technical documentation; as well as IoT and Augmented Reality.

In the industrial and manufacturing space, application lifecycle management is an attractive growth area, because more software is being embedded into products and more products are becoming software- defined. These solutions enable traceability and compliance with industry regulations, which is particularly important given the highly regulated nature of their verticals served (like med- tech and automotive). PTC's Codebeamer application lifecycle management solution is a requirements management offering for software development. IBM's Rational DOORS Next Generation tool is a visible competitor but supposedly not as highly regarded among software engineers as PTC's Codebeamer solution. Jama Connect (of Jama Software) is often praised for its intuitive ease of use but is a less robust comprehensive offering when compared to Codebeamer. Siemens's Polarion solution also offers change and configuration solutions as well as test and quality management.
PTC has been relatively acquisitive, having completed over 20 acquisitions since its founding (such as Windchill for PLM, ServiceMax for SLM, and Codebeamer for ALM).
Today the company is more focused on organic growth
Earlier this year, Bloomberg reported that a large US- based competitor called ADSK was exploring purchasing PTC, but has since announced it is not actively considering the asset.

PTC Net Debt/EBITDA versus Key Peers
Source. J.P. Morgan estimates.
- We model 9% forward 2YR Revenue CAGR and 1pp of EBITDA margin decline (CY2025E-27E)
- Theme #1: Need to accelerate development process
- PLM connects stakeholders across a product's lifecycle and quickly incorporates feedback into product development- Solid underlying customer demand
- Theme #2: More embedded software
- PTC's Codebeamer aids in requirements management for software embedded in hardware- Increasingly important in highly regulated industries such as autos and med tech
- Theme #3: Sluggish spending environment among customers reflected in a downgrade of ARR outlook
Companies Discussed in This Report (all prices in this report as of market close on 28 August 2025, unless otherwise indicated) PTC Inc(PTC/\$215.03/N)
PTC Inc (PTC, PTC US) Price Chart

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Rsearch Analyst's, or the Rsearch Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Rsearch Analyst's, or the Rsearch Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Rsearch Analyst's, or the Rsearch Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe.
